meta_description: The Museum is currently CLOSED for installation until February 9, 2026.We reopen on February 10, 2026 with Spring exhibitions.—
hours_text:
Admission to the Museum is FREE and open to everyone. 

Admission to the Museum is FREE and open to everyone. 

## **Museum Hours**

**Monday** 10am-5pm  
**Tuesday** 10am-5pm  
**Wednesday** 10am-5pm  
**Thursday** 10am-7pm  
  
**Friday** CLOSED  
**Saturday** CLOSED  
**Sunday** CLOSED 

**Select Second Saturdays** 10am-2pm

* * *

### Address

Carolyn Campagna Kleefeld Contemporary Art Museum  
Cal State Long Beach, Horn Center  
1250 Bellflower Boulevard  
Long Beach, CA 90840

### Directions

Carolyn Campagna Kleefeld Contemporary Art Museum is located on the lower campus of California State University, Long Beach in the Horn Center building.

It is recommended that you refer to the [printable CSULB map](/sites/default/files/document/campus-map_2.pdf "csulb.edu/sites/default/files/groups/campus-maps/campus-map.pdf"), where Carolyn Campagna Kleefeld Contemporary Art Museum is designated as "KCAM." 

### Parking

Museum events are free and open to the public. Parking on Cal State Long Beach campus is paid. 

**Parking permits are available for purchase via the**[**ParkMobile App**](/parking-and-transportation-services/article/parkmobile-app)**or in-person at parking pay stations.** A license plate number is required when purchasing a parking permit.

For the most current parking prices, please visit the[ ](https://www.csulb.edu/parking-and-transportation-services)[C](/parking-and-transportation-services/permits/permit-information)[SULB Parking and Transportation](https://...
admission_text:
##  First-Time, First-Year Students (Freshmen)__

Students who are, or soon will be, high school graduates and have never attended a college or university since high school.

  * [First-Time, First-Year Student Admission Eligibility](/admissions/first-time-first-year-student-admission-eligibility)
  * [First-Time, First-Year Student Application Process ](/admissions/first-time-first-year-student-application-process)
  * [Eligibility Index](/admissions/first-time-first-year-student-csulb-index)

##  Transfer Students __

Students that have completed coursework at a college or university since leaving high school, but have not yet completed a bachelor’s degree.

  * [Transfer Admission Eligibility](/admissions/transfer-admission-eligibility)
  * [Transfer Application Process ](/admissions/transfer-application-process)
  * [Transfer Major-Specific Requirements ](/admissions/major-specific-degree-requirements-for-transfer-students)
  * [Associate Degree for Transfers (ADT)](/admissions/transfer-adt-program)
  * [Supplemental Application](/admissions/supplemental-application)

##  Graduate Students __

Students that hold a bachelor’s degree and wish to continue their education for personal enrichment or to meet professional needs by pursuing a master’s or doctoral degree.

  * [Graduate Admission Eligibility ](/admissions/graduate-programs-admission-eligibility)
  * [Graduate Programs Application Process ](/admissions/graduate-programs-application-process)

##  Doctoral Students _...
accessibility_text:
## Summary

California State University (CSU) [Executive Order 1111](https://calstate.policystat.com/policy/6590867/latest/), dated May 23, 2018, outlines the CSU’s commitment that persons with disabilities enjoy the same services in an equally effective manner or are provided reasonable accommodation(s) to participate in University programs and activities in ways that are equal to those afforded others.

## Conformance

California State University, Long Beach (CSULB) makes information and communications technology accessible to all students, employees and the general public by employing the 2017 Section 508 guidelines that align with the [Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1 AA](https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG21/). CSULB additionally strives to meet updated [WCAG 2.2 AA](https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/) standards.

Some ways CSULB supports conformance:

  * Include accessibility throughout our internal policies
  * Integrate accessibility into our procurement practices
  * Supply continual accessibility training for our employees
  * Required accessibility training for access to specific systems
  * Assign clear accessibility goals and responsibilities
  * Regular automated and manual accessibility testing

## Compatibility with browsers and assistive technology

The CSU Long Beach Website is compatible with most modern assistive technologies and has been tested with the following configurations:

  * Chrome with NVDA (22.1 or later) or JAWS (2021 or later) on Windows 10...
